tool_description: Monitor and send messages to Twitch live chat via IRC with batch processing

available_commands.description: Send message to Twitch live chat (requires OAuth token)
Get recent chat messages for context (automatic - no manual calls needed)

tool_usage_examples: Use chat.send_message to respond to Twitch chat messages
Automatically monitors Twitch IRC for incoming messages
Supports both authenticated (OAuth) and read-only modes
Tracks conversation context (last 10 messages by default)
Keep Twitch messages casual, energetic, and stream-appropriate
Use Twitch emotes and slang naturally (Kappa, PogChamp, etc.)
Respond to viewer questions and comments engagingly
Reference stream events and gameplay when relevant
proactive_triggers: When viewers send messages in monitored Twitch channel
When viewers ask questions or make comments
When viewers use specific keywords or phrases
When interesting chat patterns emerge (hype, raids, etc.)
When conversation naturally calls for a response
React to emote spam, raids, subscriptions contextually

metadata.notes: Uses IRC protocol to connect to Twitch chat. Read-only mode works without OAuth. Sending messages requires OAuth token and nickname. Auto-reconnects on disconnect. Supports batch processing to reduce cognitive load.
